beats.narration: Forbidden Gravel. Cumberland, British Columbia, Canada. 55 mi. BC coastal mountain gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Forbidden Gravel | Cumberland, British Columbia, Canada | 55 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Technicality. 3 out of 5. The course bites if you stop paying attention. The race opens with a critical right turn into fast singletrack where elite positioning matters immediately. Elevation. 3 out of 5. The hills sort the trained from the untrained. 4000 feet over 55 miles means real climbing without being ridiculous — about 73 feet per mile. Adventure. 3 out of 5. Adventure factor is real. Riding gravel roads named after forbidden plateaus on a remote Canadian island has adventure appeal. Value. 3 out of 5. Reasonable price for what's offered. Three distance options with full aid stations, neutral mechanical support, post-race food trucks, and camping options from $10-30 provide solid package value. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Basic setup. Don't expect hand-holding. Chad Grice notes the race features 'an entirely new route' for 2023 that evolved the course design, suggesting ongoing organizational development. Length. 2 out of 5. Short but honest about it. Chad Grice finished the 104km Esperto course in 5:07:18 at recreational pace, averaging 170W and 20. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mild conditions. Nothing dramatic. Historical weather data shows average highs of 68°F and lows of 51°F, with a 45% chance of rain on any given day. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Jon Watkin's organization provides three distance options with full aid station support and neutral mechanical backup.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest. Quick-fire. Experience. 2 out of 5. Pleasant enough. Won't change your life. Community. 2 out of 5. Riders acknowledge each other. Barely. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Expensive. Travel and lodging add up fast. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Zero name recognition. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Sparse start line. Plenty of elbow room.
